intro: Biris sibirica, commonly known as Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern regions. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
